item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
and again people confuse the way liquids are rendered with how they are modelled.

They can use fluid physics modeling while still basically using millions of tiny particles to render the water on screen. The math underneath it defines how it behaves.

But yes it doesn’t make sense to use a perfect mathematical model of fluids in this gameplay mechanic as you are just spraying it onto a surface to be able to cross over so they can cheat a lot.
Also they just paint it with decals. We all know how they made this effect. That is not what is interesting about this.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Half-dude:

OooOoh, me likes the crumbed/cracked surface on the ASHPD. But man, that real-time liquid system in the game looks sexy… I have no idea how they were able to program something like that… I mean when you think about all the angles people can have it spray from AND having it react to gravity at the same time…

They’re just big ass particles/models, there’s no fluid simulation in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: Morrussian
item.description:
Cameron :smiley: :

Ya know… The cake is actually a cube…

Oh I agree, I’ve always said that the cake never was a lie…
See, companion cube was a mini-fridge keeping the cake fresh, and you killed it, you killed your only friend and your cake, so you couldn’t share it… but that’s alright, because companion cube still loves you…

item.description:
Im suprised NO ONE has said anything about the 1998 copyright at the beggining of the video… Which I have no main purpose of it, but, was this gel already made during the time of Portal 1, just not in the test chambers you were sent through, or was this AFTER? And the robots have been building shit on there own, which would mean that Portal MIGHT take place BEFORE the resonance cascade… any other crazy thoughts?

item.description:
I’m pretty sure that some of it was mocked scenario/later in the game. It’s not unusual for “leaked” footage to be completely inconsequential to the actual released game.

[sidebar]
BY THE WAY… is anyone else pissed that the new Zelda game apparently won’t let you use lefty controls, when Link IS LEFTY?!

[/sidebar]

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
fun part is that neither of them have been working on improving the game graphics lately.
Remember they have the consoles to cater for. Oh yes I went there again.

I didn’t feel Portal 1 was too difficult. I managed to get through that after a couple days with it.
But the mod Portal: Prelude was really difficult. Oh and those other third-party maps. There was even this map with a rotating room. That one was crazy.

Do you guys have examples of other difficult / down right crazy maps for portal?

And I probably spend a bit too much time in front of the computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: NoPetrol
item.description:
Why can’t Valve be more like other game companies and stop making everyone else look bad? I mean, they should just be focusing on improving their games’ graphics, making their guns more realistic, improving their games’ graphics, making their games look more like movies, and improving their games’ graphics instead of working on entirely original mechanics and making games that are just downright fun to play. You know, like every other FPS making company in the world.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
You might just not be a spacial person. I know a lot of people can have trouble visualizing 3D space in their heads.

For example those dice problems you find in math books where they ask you which side is opposite of another with 3 pictures. I’m really good at them, but some people can’t get that 3 dimensional space in their heads to find the solution. I imagine you would have the same problem with Portal.

That or sometimes good problem solvers can have trouble noticing things when they’re too obvious. If you’re normally good at solving puzzles like this you might just be overthinking them and thus find them more confusing than they actually are.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Axen:

L4D2 was a massive disappointment to many, me among them. It just had nowhere near the atmosphere that the first had.

More on topic though I am optimistic about portal 2. Despite the videos making it seem like reflexes are the key to this game I’m sure that these quick acting moments are just the culmination of much planning just like in the first.

L4D had atmosphere?

On topic: I agree with this guy.

item.title: Portal !
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
johnyo:

I am also not too keen on valve introducing so many new gameplay elements in P2, but I’m sure they’ll make it work.

Bear in mind that Portal 2 is going to be a full length game, rather than the cautious experiment that the original Portal was. It promises to be at least two or three times longer, so there’ll be plenty of time to introduce all of these new gameplay elements at a relaxed pace.

Read full topic
